easy.definition: A round fruit with red or green skin.
A round object used in many sports and games.
A small furry pet animal that meows.
A friendly pet animal that barks.
An oval food item from birds, often chicken.
An animal that lives and swims in water.
Green plants that cover the ground outside.
Something you wear on your head.
Frozen water that is very cold.
To push off the ground with your legs.
A toy that flies in the wind on a string.
An object that gives light in a room.
The round object in the sky at night.
A home built by a bird for its eggs.
A very large body of salt water.
A tool used for writing with ink.
A female ruler of a country.
Water that falls from clouds in the sky.
The bright star that gives light to Earth.
A tall plant with a trunk and branches.
A large car used for carrying things.
A clear liquid we drink and use to wash.
A picture that shows inside your body.
A toy on a string that goes up and down.
An animal with black and white stripes.
A small insect that lives in groups.
Pages with words and stories to read.
A sweet food often eaten at birthdays.
A table used for writing or studying.
The body part used for hearing sounds.
A small green animal that jumps and swims.
A sticky substance used to join things.
The stuff growing on your head.
Colored liquid used in pens for writing.
A sweet spread made from fruit.
A metal object used to open locks.
The green part of a plant or tree.
A drawing that shows where places are.
The body part used for smelling.
A bird with big eyes that hunts at night.
An animal kept at home for company.
A warm cover made of cloth pieces.
A hard substance that forms the Earth.
A bright point of light in the night sky.
An object children play with for fun.
A thing used to keep you dry in the rain.
A musical instrument with strings.
A wild animal similar to a large dog.
A flying insect that makes honey.
A small disc used to fasten clothes.
A white or gray shape in the sky.
A mythical fire-breathing creature.
A large gray animal with a long trunk.
A part of your hand used for touching.
An area where plants and flowers grow.
A sweet, sticky food made by bees.
Land surrounded by water on all sides.
A forest with many trees and animals.
An animal that hops and has a pouch.
A sour, yellow fruit used in drinks.
An animal that climbs trees and has a tail.
A thin tool used for sewing.
A round, sweet fruit with a peel.
A writing tool made of wood and lead.
Something you ask to get information.
An arch of colors in the sky after rain.
A tool used for cutting paper.
A hard white thing in your mouth for biting.
A magical horse with a horn on its head.
A mountain that can erupt with lava.
A clear part of a wall to see through.
Long thread used for knitting.
A fastener with interlocking teeth.
Creative work like painting or drawing.
A structure built over water or roads.
A stick of wax that burns to give light.
A musical instrument you hit to play.
The part of your face used for seeing.
Hot, burning flames that give heat.
Something given to someone as a present.
An area of land higher than surroundings.
A dome-shaped house made of ice blocks.
A soft, wiggly food made from fruit juice.
A male ruler of a country.
A set of steps used to climb up or down.
Sounds combined to make songs or tunes.
The dark time when the sun is not out.
A hot box used for cooking food.
A round, flat food with toppings.
Making very little or no noise.
A machine that can move and do tasks.
Something you wear to protect your feet.
A large wild cat with orange and black stripes.
Special clothes worn by a group of people.
A sleeveless piece of clothing.
A very large animal that lives in the ocean.
A container with a lid for storing things.
A large, hairy cow-like animal.
A place where wild animals are kept.

normal.definition: A branch of math using letters and symbols.
The study of living organisms.
Long-term weather patterns in an area.
A formal discussion of opposing viewpoints.
The system of money and trade in a country.
Literature based on imagination, not fact.
The math of shapes, sizes, and positions.
The study of past events and civilizations.
A global network of connected computers.
Fair treatment and behavior in society.
Related to motion and movement of objects.
Related to literature and written works.
A figure of speech comparing unlike things.
A cell that transmits nerve impulses.
Produced without artificial chemicals.
The science of matter, energy, and motion.
Related to the behavior of atomic particles.
The art of effective speaking and writing.
People living together in a community.
A statement proven by logical reasoning.
An imagined perfect place or society.
A quantity that can change or vary.
Justification for a belief or action.
A noble gas used in some lights.
To give way or produce a result.
A fertilized egg cell.
The basic unit of a chemical element.
A large naturally occurring community of flora and fauna.
An official count of a population.
Facts and statistics collected for analysis.
The study of organisms and their environment.
The power to act or speak without restraint.
A unit of heredity in living organisms.
A regulatory substance produced in an organism.
Atoms with the same atomic number but different mass numbers.
Special words used by a profession or group.
The sum of a person's actions in this and previous states of existence.
Reasoning conducted according to strict principles.
Cell division that produces reproductive cells.
The central part of an atom or cell.
Movement of a solvent through a semipermeable membrane.
A typical example or pattern of something.
The minimum number of members needed to conduct business.
The quantitative relation between two amounts.
Things that evoke a specific functional reaction.
A supposition or system of ideas explaining something.
Relating to or characteristic of a city.
A quantity having direction as well as magnitude.
A website that allows collaborative editing of content.
One of two or more forms of a gene.
Prejudice in favor of or against something.
A substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction.
A system of government by the whole population.
A protein that acts as a biological catalyst.
A never-ending pattern that repeats itself at different scales.
The complete set of genes in an organism.
A proposed explanation for a phenomenon.
An atom or molecule with a net electric charge.
The unit of energy in the International System of Units.
The base unit of temperature in the International System.
A device that emits a narrow beam of coherent light.
Cell division resulting in two identical daughter cells.
A subatomic particle with no net electric charge.
The loss of electrons during a reaction by a molecule or atom.
A particle representing a quantum of light or other electromagnetic radiation.
A type of elementary particle and a fundamental constituent of matter.
Einstein's theory about space, time, and gravitation.
A close relationship between different species.
Relating to the structure of the Earth's crust.
A substance used to stimulate the production of antibodies.
The SI unit of power, equivalent to one joule per second.
Dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries.
A chemical substance that neutralizes alkalis.
A chemical compound that neutralizes acids.
A chemical element fundamental to all known life.
A molecule carrying genetic instructions for development.
Moral principles that govern a person's behavior.
The process of joining atomic nuclei to form heavier nuclei.
The force that attracts objects toward the center of the Earth.
The natural home or environment of an animal or plant.
A property of matter by which it remains at rest or in motion.
The largest planet in our solar system.
A movement or activity of a cell or organism.
Electromagnetic radiation that is visible to the human eye.
The SI unit for amount of substance.
The SI unit of force.
The curved path of an object around a star or planet.
A transparent object that refracts light.
An extremely luminous active galactic nucleus.
A nucleic acid present in all living cells.
A trigonometric function of an angle.
A twisting force that causes rotation.
A radioactive element used as nuclear fuel.
The SI unit of electromotive force.
A disturbance that transfers energy through matter or space.
Electromagnetic radiation of high energy and short wavelength.
A microscopic fungus used in baking and brewing.
A bluish-white metallic element.
The universe seen as a well-ordered whole.

hard.definition: Something that deviates from what is standard, normal, or expected.
A system of government with many complicated rules and processes.
Related to the mental processes of perception, memory, judgment, and reasoning.
A division or contrast between two things that are represented as being opposed or entirely different.
Based on, concerned with, or verifiable by observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic.
A mistaken belief, especially one based on unsound argument.
Relating to politics, especially international relations, as influenced by geographical factors.
Leadership or dominance, especially by one country or social group over others.
A system of ideas and ideals, especially one which forms the basis of economic or political theory and policy.
The theory or philosophy of law.
Relating to a person's awareness of the position and movement of the parts of the body.
The vocabulary of a person, language, or branch of knowledge.
Awareness and understanding of one's own thought processes.
A new word or expression, or a new meaning for an existing word.
A small group of people having control of a country, organization, or institution.
A typical example or pattern of something; a model.
Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
The art of effective or persuasive speaking or writing, especially the use of figures of speech and other compositional techniques.
A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage.
The saying of the same thing twice in different words, generally considered to be a fault of style.
Present, appearing, or found everywhere.
Showing strong feeling; forceful, passionate, or intense.
A particular philosophy or view of life; the worldview of an individual or group.
Dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries.
A wooden crosspiece that is fastened over the necks of two animals and attached to the plow or cart that they are to pull.
The defining spirit or mood of a particular period of history as shown by the ideas and beliefs of the time.
Relating to or using a process or set of rules to be followed in calculations or problem-solving.
A system in which a record of transactions made in bitcoin or another cryptocurrency are maintained across several computers.
A digital currency in which encryption techniques are used to regulate the generation of units of currency and verify the transfer of funds.
A political leader who seeks support by appealing to the desires and prejudices of ordinary people rather than by using rational argument.
The theory of knowledge, especially with regard to its methods, validity, and scope.
Involving trust, especially with regard to the relationship between a trustee and a beneficiary.
The practice of manipulating the boundaries of an electoral constituency to favor one party or class.
Of the same kind; alike; composed of parts all of the same kind.
Security against or exemption from legal liability for one's actions.
The fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect.
A government with corrupt leaders that use their power to exploit the people and natural resources of their own territory.
Unreasonably prone to go to law to settle disputes.
A system such as a pattern of letters, ideas, or associations which assists in remembering something.
The practice among those with power or influence of favoring relatives or friends, especially by giving them jobs.
The branch of metaphysics dealing with the nature of being.
The method and practice of teaching, especially as an academic subject or theoretical concept.
A favor or advantage granted or expected in return for something.
A system of politics or principles based on practical rather than moral or ideological considerations.
The view or theory that the self is all that can be known to exist.
The branch of science concerned with classification, especially of organisms.
The right to enjoy the use and advantages of another's property short of the destruction or waste of its substance.
The appearance of being true or real.
A feeling of melancholy and worldweariness.
